accuracy.description: Accuracy measures aim and precision, and measures your ability to hit targets with ranged or thrown weapons.

focuses.name: Bows
focuses.description: Proficiency with string-fired weapons, from a handdrawn compound bow to a mechanical crossbow.

focuses.name: Gunnery
focuses.description: Proficiency with precision heavy ranged weapons, including ship-mounted weapons.

focuses.name: Pistols
focuses.description: Proficiency with single-grip, short-barrel ballistic weapons.

focuses.name: Rifles
focuses.description: Proficiency with double-grip, long-barrel ballistic weapons.

focuses.name: Throwing
focuses.description: Proficiency with thrown weapons, including grenades.

communication.description: Communication covers social skills and generally making friends and influencing people.

focuses.name: Bargaining
focuses.description: Negotiating with others and making deals.

focuses.name: Deception
focuses.description: Tricking and lying to other people.

focuses.name: Disguise
focuses.description: Changing your appearance to look like someone else.

focuses.name: Etiquette
focuses.description: Knowing the social niceties of various cultures.

focuses.name: Expression
focuses.description: Conveying thoughts and ideas effectively through words.

focuses.name: Gambling
focuses.description: Playing games of chance and profiting from them.

focuses.name: Investigation
focuses.description: Interviewing people for information and finding and deciphering clues.

focuses.name: Leadership
focuses.description: Guiding, directing, and inspiring others.

focuses.name: Performing
focuses.description: Entertaining an audience with a type of performance art.

focuses.name: Persuasion
focuses.description: Convincing others to agree with you.

focuses.name: Seduction
focuses.description: Getting attention through romantic and sexual allure.

constitution.description: Constitution is your character’s overall health, fortitude, and resistance to harm, illness, and fatigue.

focuses.name: Running
focuses.description: Moving quickly in both short sprints and longdistance hauls.

focuses.name: Stamina
focuses.description: Enduring fatigue, disease, and privation.

focuses.name: Swimming
focuses.description: Moving across water and staying afloat.

focuses.name: Tolerance
focuses.description: Withstanding the effects of potentially toxic substances, imbibed for recreation or unwitting exposure.

dexterity.description: Dexterity covers deftness, agility, and reaction time, affecting how quickly and gracefully you move.

focuses.name: Acrobatics
focuses.description: Executing gymnastic, balancing, and tumbling maneuvers.

focuses.name: Crafting
focuses.description: Making things with manual skills, including the various fine and plastic arts. Examples of specific Crafting focuses include Carpentry, Carving, Drawing, Glass-blowing, Leather-working, Painting, Origami, Sculpting, and so forth, but feel free to come up with your own. See the Unusual Focuses sidebar for more.

focuses.name: Driving
focuses.description: Handling surface vehicles like cars, trucks, or motorized carts, to name a few.

focuses.name: Free-Fall
focuses.description: Maneuvering and moving while in free-fall, usually in microgravity.

focuses.name: Initiative
focuses.description: Reacting quickly under pressure.

focuses.name: Piloting
focuses.description: Operating vehicles that move in three dimensions like aircraft, drones, and spaceships.

focuses.name: Sleight of Hand
focuses.description: Using sleight of hand and deft movements to trick others, hide things, or pick pockets.

focuses.name: Stealth
focuses.description: Moving around without being noticed.

fighting.description: Fighting is your character’s capability and prowess in close combat, ranging from a brawl to wielding weapons.

focuses.name: Brawling
focuses.description: Proficiency in fighting unarmed, from bareknuckle boxing to various styles of martial arts.

focuses.name: Grappling
focuses.description: Proficiency in unarmed techniques intended to immobilize and restrain.

focuses.name: Heavy Weapons
focuses.description: Proficiency with large or heavy close combat weapons like axes, clubs, hammers, and large swords, to name a few.

focuses.name: Light Weapons
focuses.description: Proficiency with light close combat weapons like batons, knives, light staffs, and swords, among others.

intelligence.description: Intelligence measures a character’s reasoning, memory, problem-solving, and overall knowledge.

focuses.name: Art
focuses.description: Knowledge of artistic movements, styles, artists, and works in any of the fine arts. Making art uses the Crafting focus.

focuses.name: Business
focuses.description: Knowledge of running a business as well as of the business and corporate world.

focuses.name: Cryptography
focuses.description: Creating and deciphering codes and ciphers.

focuses.name: Current Affairs
focuses.description: Knowledge of politics, newsworthy events, and popular culture.

focuses.name: Demolitions
focuses.description: Identifying, using, and safely handling explosives, as well as understanding their effects and detonation methods.

focuses.name: Engineering
focuses.description: Making, repairing, and maintaining technological items as well as knowledge of the principles and practicalities of their design and development.

focuses.name: Evaluation
focuses.description: Knowledge of the value of goods, works of art, and other valuables.

focuses.name: Law
focuses.description: Knowledge of codes, regulations, and different legal proceedings of all levels of the judiciary and law enforcement.

focuses.name: Medicine
focuses.description: Tending to the sick and injured, and understanding medical and anatomical knowledge.

focuses.name: Navigation
focuses.description: Planning and following a route from one place to another, interpreting maps and cartographic data, and figuring out where you are.

focuses.name: Research
focuses.description: Conducting a systematic search for information, usually using records, archives, and books.

focuses.name: Science
focuses.description: Knowledge of an organized field of study and the ability to understand things related to it. Examples of Science focuses include Anthropology, Astronomy, Botany, Biology, Chemistry, Economics, Genetics, History, Planetary or “Earth” Sciences, Physics, Psychology, and Theology, but you can choose another scientific field, if you wish (see the Unusual Focuses sidebar).

focuses.name: Security
focuses.description: Knowledge of different security devices, systems, protocols, and personnel.

focuses.name: Tactics
focuses.description: Knowledge of strategy, tactics, and famous applications thereof.

focuses.name: Technology
focuses.description: Knowledge of the design and operation of technology, particularly computers, which are incorporated into nearly all technological items in The Expanse.

perception.description: Perception is the ability to pick up on and notice things using any of the character’s senses.

focuses.name: Empathy
focuses.description: Picking up on and interpreting the feelings and emotions of others.

focuses.name: Hearing
focuses.description: Perceiving using your auditory sense.

focuses.name: Intuition
focuses.description: Having a “gut feeling” about certain things you can’t otherwise sense.

focuses.name: Searching
focuses.description: Finding things that are hidden or obscured, such as hidden compartments.

focuses.name: Seeing
focuses.description: Perceiving using your visual sense.

focuses.name: Smelling
focuses.description: Perceiving using your olfactory sense.

focuses.name: Survival
focuses.description: Practical skills of wilderness survival.

focuses.name: Tasting
focuses.description: Perceiving using your gustatory sense.

focuses.name: Touching
focuses.description: Perceiving using your tactile sense.

focuses.name: Tracking
focuses.description: Following tracks and other signs of passage.

strength.description: Strength is sheer muscle power and the ability to apply it, from lifting heavy things to feats of athletics.

focuses.name: Climbing
focuses.description: Scaling walls and other vertical obstacles.

focuses.name: Intimidation
focuses.description: Overawing others with your physical presence and threats.

focuses.name: Jumping
focuses.description: Making standing or running jumps.

focuses.name: Might
focuses.description: Feats of raw power, such as lifting or holding up heavy objects.

willpower.description: Willpower measures self-control, self-discipline, mental fortitude, and confidence.

focuses.name: Courage
focuses.description: Overcoming fear in the face of adversity.

focuses.name: Faith
focuses.description: Deriving inner strength through spiritual or moral belief.

focuses.name: Self-Discipline
focuses.description: Focusing your mental energy or controlling your impulses and emotions.
